fields.summary: People Calendar Auto-Suggestion Only Responds to 'username'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50803].
  {panel}

When upgrading to Confluence 3.5 I backed up all of the calendars (via .ics files) that were found anywhere on my Confluence install. Then I uninstalled the plugin, upgraded Confuence, and installed Team Calendars.

The problem is that the only way I seem to be able to add the calendars back is as one of "my" calendars. I know that they can be embedded in any space, but this is not only annoying for me (to have all calendars that I ported over for my users sitting in my calendars) but it's going to be a political problem if people feel like they have lost control over their calendars.

Please tell me how I can reassign the owners -- a SQL query, some configuration file modification, etc.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Need to reassign calendar ownership to old plugin calendar owners

fields.summary: getSubCalendar Unable to determine time zone
Creating a JIRA calendars shows the "Add event" option in the feature discovery dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50795].
  {panel}

Using an iCal/ICS feed, clicking on an event/appointment displays a basic popup listing:
* a calendar icon
* the subject (title)
* the name of the Confluence calendar the event/appointment comes from

Scrolling the window/iframe, by either using the mouse wheel or clicking & dragging, results in the popup moving from the context where is originally appeared.

Browsers:
* Firefox 4.0.1
* Chrome 12.0.742.91
* Internet Explorer 9.0.8112.16421
fields.summary: Event/Appointment Popup doesn't stick with Event/Appointment when scrolling

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50794].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up JIRA and Confluence with Team Calendars, and link the two systems
# Create issues and versions in JIRA, with due dates, and resolved dates
# Add a calendar using either Project, Saved Filter or JQL (not relevant to this scenario)
# Select Issue Due Date only to display
#- Observe that the Issue Summary displays, but no Issue Key is displays
# Edit the properties of the Calendar and select Issue Created Date to display as well
#- Observe that now, both Issue Created and Issue Due entries have the Issue Key displayed
# Edit the calendar and select any combination of 2 or more of the 3 Issue Dates
#- Observe that issue keys are displayed
# Edit the calendar and select only one of the Issue Dates
#- Observe that issue keys are not displayed
# Edit the calendar and select only one of the Issue Dates along with the Version Due Date
#- Observe that issue keys are not displayed
fields.summary: JIRA Calendar only displays Issue Key if more than one Issue Date is selected
Selecting a user from the 'Who' field for a People Calendar event puts your cursor focus back to the 'Calendar' drop-down

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50792].
  {panel}

I have installed today Team Calendars to replace the previous used calendar macro that does not work any more in Confluence 4.1.x. I can create a calender in {{My Calendar}}, and add there dates and even import ones from the old Confluence Calendar that I have exported previously. But I am not able to integrate the calendar in a wiki page.

This is what happens when I try to:

# I start in the wiki page, and go into edit mode.
# I then insert `{team` and get as completion option {{Team Calendar}}.
# I select that, and the usual parameters are shown.
# I am able to insert the beginning of an existing calendar, and it is added below.
# I don't see an update on the  left, and when I press {{Refresh}}, I see the message: {{The macro 'calendar' is unknown. It may have been removed from the system.}}
# When I then press {{Insert}}, nothing is inserted in the page.

I have installed the plugin by downloading the jar-file (was not able to find it through plugin manager), I have first disable "Confluence Calendar", and then even deinstalled it, but the result is all the time the same.

----

I have then tried to deinstall the plugin, and reinstall it again, and I was then able to insert the macro in a wiki page successfully. There seems to be a cache for macros that was filled when the old calendar macro was deactivated, but installed, so that there was some conflict. The issue could then be closed for me.
fields.summary: Not able to embed the team calender in a confluence wiki page
Subscribe to team calendar on Google Calender gives Could Not Fetch the URL
"The uploaded data does not seem to be iCalendar content" Germany translation is wrong
adding Team Calendars macro to Doc Theme navigation sidebar shows hidden modal windows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50787].
  {panel}

When you have a Jira Calendar which shows versions, it displays the error {{Jira Calendar Test truncated to show only 1,000 issues events}} even if you have less than 1,000 versions. The limitation should check only the items displayed in the Calendar and not only issues.

+Repro steps:+
# In a Jira project create a few versions in the same month.
# Generate over 1,000 issues for that project in the same month
# In Confluence, add a Jira Calendar and show only _Version Due Date_.

Even if there are less than 1,000 versions, Team Calendars display the error message.
fields.summary: Unnecesary truncation error
TC macro appears in the editor as an inline macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50784].
  {panel}

http://cl.ly/1q1j2n112V3v003t3y0r

Steps to re-produce:
1. Insert a calendar using the macro
2. Autocomplete one calendar and keypress down, select it
3. Now tab to other fields, You'll notice that the autocomplete dropdown doesn't go away, this makes selecting the fields behind it kinda sucky 

Chrome, mac
fields.summary: Adding some calendars to a macro using autocomplete doesn't get rid of the calendar drop-down autocomplete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50782].
  {panel}

1. Open the calendar restriction dialog
2. Type the name of the user you want to add a restriction for e.g. 'admin'
3. Press enter

You will get an error message even if you entered the name correctly (see screenshot). For contrast the page permissions dialog does allow this.
fields.summary: Can't add a restriction to a calendar without using the drop down
Team Calendars do not show month

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50759].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a new calendar.
# Create 3 events for 3 different users. 
(!) Set the date for example: Dec 13 to Dec 20
# Create a page and insert the Team Calendar Macro, and choose the 'List' method.
# You'll have a screen like this:
!bug.jpg!

h3. Workaround:
There's no workaround.
fields.summary: Mismatching Dates on Calendar List

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50758].
  {panel}

The values in the "Show" field will include all fields that use date picker or date time that have been created for the OD instance

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Setup two JIRA projects. Make sure each project has at least one unique field that uses date time or date picker inputs
# Create a Jira Calendar in a linked Confluence instance (in this case both Jira and Confluenc were part of an OD instance https://confluence-ondemand-stable-gapps.jira-dev.com)
# Change the Project in the Project field in the Create JIRA calendar dialogue

[video|http://screencast.com/t/MvRhMj2viS]
fields.summary: "Show" field does not hide fields that are not available on selected project
Upcoming Events duplicate on Confluence dashboard
In on-demand mode, the licensing form is still accessible via UPM

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50751].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a JIRA calendar on EAC, server = JDOG
2. Try to plot out version due dates 

You get this error http://cl.ly/image/3G3g1p3E1F0n

Two problems:
1. The error isnt accurate "too many issues" - should probably say "too many events"
2. We should make it render for ~100 versions - why is it rendering for those versions?
fields.summary: Unable to create calendar because of too many issues error renders for ~100 versions
Cannot create jira calendar in 4.3.x and Jira 4.4.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50741].
  {panel}

As describe on the summary, in preview mode Team Calendar does not resize space logo accordingly and displayed in real size.

Here is the screenshot from 2.2 version

!2.2Tcal.png|thumbnail!

There is no such issue on Team Calendar release version 2.0

!2.0Tcal.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: In preview mode, space logo displayed in full size

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50737].
  {panel}

Multi-byte text of summary in People Calendar is displayed with HTML escaping.

My testing result is:
|| Calendar View type || Result ||
| month | (x) |
| week | (x) |
| list | (/) |
| upcoming | (/) |
(/) : Not HTML escaped.
(x) : HTML escaped.

Best regards,
Kan Ogawa
fields.summary: Summary text is displayed with HTML escaping.
Error(s) occurred. Unable to load events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50733].
  {panel}

h3.Problem
When you receive a notification from Team Calendars:
{quote}
You are receiving this notification because you are watching the following:
    [Vacations|http://heck.com:8090/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=b8f3a4e6-2065-4400-8cd4-f9347e651730]
{quote}
It will present your link to view them, and will be asked to add this calendar to your with an "Add it now" link.

When you click this link, it will automatically break all your calendars, and you'll be presented with:
{code}
(-) Error(s) occurred.
    500 - 
{code}

There is nothing in the logs

h3.Steps to reproduce (Assuming you already have a working mail server)
# Install Confluence,
# Install Team Calendars
# Create a calendar
# Create an event, and add this event to a user
# This user will receive an mail notification, open it, and the link should be something like:
#* http://heck.com:8090/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=b8f3a4e6-2065-4400-8cd4-f9347e651730
# Add it now
# Voila! 500 error page forever.

h3.Workaround
The workaround as much as it is not perfect it allows the user to still browse the calendar, just access the calendar through the link provided on the mail notification
fields.summary: Link coming from Mail Notification breaks Calendar.
Selecting "share" from the feature discovery dialog doesn't automatically select the calendar URL in the text area
Team Calendars doesn´t respect the time settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50726].
  {panel}

The calendar don't respect an priority order.

If the event last longer than the previous, it'll go to the top.
!tc1.jpg!
If the same event has one day less than the other it'll go to the top again.
!tc2.jpg!
fields.summary: Events don't have solid order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50723].
  {panel}

When using a clean version of Confluence 4.2.13 and installing the latest Team Calender plugin there are several things that does not work.

The macro panel itself opens but clicking on a calendar closes the panel and no calendar is inserted.

Inserting a calendar with Firefox and opening the page again with IE will render the calendar just fine. Clicking on 'Add event' or somewhere in the calendar will result in no action.

Error:
Webpage error details

fields.summary: Confluence 4.2.13 - 4.3.6 with TeamCalendar on IE8 or IE9 does not work
The Team Calendars macro is still displayed in the macro browser in OnDemand when Team Calendars is not licensed
defaultView for list/upcoming view is inconsistently handled
Unable to load events and limit issues
Calendar view buttons move around in an annoying fashion when you click them
Bad link in notifications
Summaries of repeating people events get double HTML encoded after deletion of trailing recurrences
Team Calendar CSS overrides generic '.ui-icon' rule in Confluence 4.3., 4.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50687].
  {panel}

h3.Problem

Once you've setup a JIRA Calender with a few issues to retrieve Confluence Team Calendars keeps spinning and takes some time to load the events.

It depends on how much events you are picking up from JIRA.

This has some connection to TEAMCAL-646 but does not need to be custom fields.

h3.Steps to reproduce(assuming that you have a working version of Confluence, and have already installed Team Calendars)

# Setup Application links with jira.atlassian.com
# Configure this newly created link, and go to "Outgoing Authentication"
# Go to "Basic Access" and use your own credentials for jira.atlassian.com
# Create a new Calendar, Select JIRA Calendar
# Name as you want, no need for description or space.
# Server, select Atlassian JIRA
# Display, Saved filter and type CONF Top... and it should bring CONF Top Voted New Features and Improvements, select this
# Select all check boxes.
# Save

Now it will take about 10 seconds to load all events, sometimes more.

h3.Workaround
There is none yet
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Calendar Performance
If you click on another page while a calendar macro or dashboard mycaledars is loading you get an error
Version due dates not displayed for JQL query using category
Drag and drop is not working with Confluence 4.3

Every non-ascii characters in upcoming events section on the dashboard appear as '?'.

Best regards,
Kan Ogawa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50649].
  {panel}

I changed the *JIRA base URL and Confluence base URL* in last week because of server migration.
After then, I re-installed plug-in, JIRA and Confluence team calendars, and connected them each other.
JIRA team calendar is working well, but Confluence calendar has some problem.

In Confluence calendars, it can't change JIRA base URL (it has previous JIRA base URL).

*I want to change JIRA base URL in Confluence team calendar.*

Can you help me?

Please comment or e-mail yongpyo.hong@gmail.com

Regards.

Yongpyo Hong

I found a KB entry and some info from Jira issues, but they did not help.
I am using Oracle 11g with isolation level 2 set in the confluence.cfg.xml.
fields.summary: Unable to install Team Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50640].
  {panel}

When trying to add a Team Calendar into Google calendar gives "The address that you provided did not contain a calendar in a valid iCal or GData format."

Here the steps I took to reproduce the issue.

1. Create a new events calendar upon Team Calendar
2. Click on the new calendar and click in Subscribe
3. Copy the URL
4. Go to Google Calendar and go other Calendar -> Add it by URL
5. Paste the URL and click on Add Calendar

The same issue was opened before in Confluence project: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24764
fields.summary: Team Calendar subscribe doesn't work in Google Calendar and gives not valid iCal or GData format error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50637].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create an event that spans across 2 days at minimum, example: May 16th - May 17th
# Embed the Calendar into a Confluence page that allows an anonymous user to view anonymously
# Logout, and view the page anonymously

h3.Observed Behavior
While viewing anonymously, this is shown:
!teamcalendars2.jpg!

But once logged in, the issue disappears:
!teamcalendars1.jpg!
fields.summary: 'Unable to format date/time' error when viewing an event anonymously
Editing confluence pages brekas when team calendars plugin is enabled
License error message always says "renew your license" even if the error is not expiration-related

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50633].
  {panel}

Hi,

Our calendars are all internal (i.e. vacation, corporate events, etc.), and so we need to restrict access to these from non-employee users such as our clients, partners, etc. I tried looking for admin permissions to configure this but couldn't find any, the only option I did find is calendar specific restrictions but even that did not help me hide our calendars. How can I hide the plugin completely from some users/groups?

Thanks,
Roei

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-50625].
  {panel}

Hi,

Our organization want to use this plugin as Team Leave Collaboration tool. We want to integrate it with our existing leave management system. 


So if a leave event is created/updated/deleted in confluence, we want to update the same in our leave management system.

Is there any api, service, listener or any other way available to achieve this?
